column4: I have an old Nvidia card and can't get linux to boot when I have it active
model?
oh need the old drivers, did you install from hardware drivers?
i think sudo apt-get install nvidia-legacy
how can i repair my x settings to use the intel card so my wife can use her computer until i have time to work on it
remember, to use the nvidia card, you can try disabling the onboard one
delete the xorg.conf file
it this ubuntu 9.10?
is it 9.10 ubuntu?
well anyways it will auto create a backup so no issues
but otherwise do this , sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf  /etc/X11/xorg.conf_bk

ok sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-76
or something with 7

you have display now or no
